repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Debbie Yow papers (dated 1976-1983, 1994, 2023, undated; 0.23 cubic feet; 1 slim document box) primarily comprise newspaper clippings, game schedules and calendars, game program and season fact book, and promotion and program flyers documenting the University of Kentucky (UK) Lady Kats women's basketball team and Debbie Yow's career as the Lady Kat head coach, 1976-1980.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged by format and subject.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Deborah Ann Debbie Yow was born on September 1, 1950, in Gibsonville, North Carolina. She graduated with a degree in English in 1974 from Elon University, where she also played basketball. She earned a master's degree in counseling from Liberty University in 1987. Yow was hired by Sue Feamster as head coach of the University of Kentucky Lady Kats women's basketball team in 1976. Yow was at UK until 1980, then coached women's basketball at Oral Roberts University (1981-1983) and the University of Florida (1983-1985). She took these three previously unranked teams into the top 20 national rankings (Debbie Yow, Wikipedia, accessed 3/2/2023). In 1985, Yow accepted a promotion and began her second career as an athletics administrator at the University of Florida and went on to the University of North Carolina-Greensboro as associate athletic director. From 1990 to 2019, Yow served as Athletic Director at Saint Louis University (1990-1994), University of Maryland (1994-2010, the first woman athletic director in any Atlantic Coast Conference school), and North Carolina State University (2010-2019). Yow received the National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics James J. Corbett Memorial Award in 2019 and was inducted into the North Carolina Sports Hall of Fame in 2006. Yow was married to Lynn Nance, 1980, and is currently married to William Bowden, 1983- . Yow's two sisters Kay Yow (1942-2009) and Susan Yow (1954- ) were/are also basketball players and coaches. Kay Yow coached the North Carolina State University women's basketball team from 1975-2009.
Sources: 1. Debbie Yow, Wikipedia, accessed 3/2/2023. 2. Susan Yow, Wikipedia, accessed 3/2/2023. 3. ancestry.com, accessed 3/2/2023.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2023ua008 : [identification of item], Debbie Yow papers, 1976-1983, 1994, 2023, undated, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Debbie Yow papers (dated 1976-1983, 1994, 2023, undated; 0.23 cubic feet; 1 slim document box) primarily comprise newspaper clippings, game schedules and calendars, game program and season fact book, and promotion and program flyers documenting the University of Kentucky (UK) Lady Kats women's basketball team and Debbie Yow's career as the Lady Kat head coach, 1976-1980. Also includes newspaper clippings about Yow's sisters Kay Yow and Susan Yow (also women's college basketball coaches); a congratulatory letter from Dick Parsons, UK men's basketball assistant coach from 1970-1980, dated February 14, 1994, in response to a laudatory clipping about Yow as Saint Louis University athletic director; and written recollections by Yow about her UK coaching career, dated February 12, 2023.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of Kentucky. The University of Kentucky holds the copyright for materials created in the course of business by University of Kentucky employees. Copyright for all other materials has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky. For information about permission to reproduce or publish, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.
